column4: mmh, how do i kill a process when kill 1234 doesn't seem to work?
try to run top, then kill it from there?
w0w. okay. try to find the parent process .. and kill it
type 'ps aux |grep -i <whatever you're trying to kill app>' ... e.g. ps aux |grep -i xmms
well, i've been doing that..albeit without the -i..for the last 5 mins.. :/
and the -i doesn't offer more processes..
i don't know anymore to tell ya. :(
what was it were you trying to kill??
wait a minute ... is your cd drive empty?? OR cd is running like crazy and won't stop/eject?
i thought so too.. if it hadn't been empty and/or was spinning i'd have umounted it first and/or ejected..
